unnormalised: She explained the importance of things like the "shoulder width" – usually around 18 inches for me, and the "sleeve length" – which I like to keep at around 25 cm from the shoulder. Then there's the "chest measurement," typically 40 inches, important for a comfortable fit. Getting these measurements right is crucial. I remember the first time I tried to make a shirt, I completely messed up the collar! Ended up being like 3 cm too big on one side. Huge blunder.

unnormalised: Now, I can confidently order fabric in "meters" and ask the tailor for specific adjustments. Also, understanding measurements helps negotiate prices too.
